channel.title: Need to talk with an average or better coder
channel.description:
I know a moderate amount of C++ and java. I know a very good amount of blitzbasic but thats a shitty language.
I have too much questions to ask all at once and i learn a lot better when im in a 1:1 conversation.
-----------------------------------------------
Here is just a list of [b]some[/b] of the questions i need answered:
317/508 server architecure How packets are sent/received Are handlers good or bad? mopar history in a far any servers coded besides java how objects are used in priv servs
-----------------------------------------------
if someone could either pm me, or email me: [email]lurtz1122334@hotmail.com[/email] or if anyone has skype just pm their info. I highly recommand someone who has skype since i communication is much faster/easier that way.

item.title: Need to talk with an average or better coder
item.dc:creator: @lurtz1230 lurtz1230
item.description:
@lurtz1230 wrote:

and a more specific question. Im trying to enhance woodcutting in a pk planet source that i have. I changed the amount of time it takes u to get logs so now its randomized. However i want to have the trees be able to cut down into stumps after all of its logs r taken. Then after awhile it would be replaced by the reg tree. Would and array be ok for that? it would store the trees total logs,x and y positions and the kind of tree. However where would i put the code to actually loop through all of that? also i know there has to be a better way to do that instead of using just the client.java

Read full topic
item.source: Need to talk with an average or better coder

item.title: Need to talk with an average or better coder
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

One of my big questions is are handlers good or bad? is it better to have 1 huge client.java or many small classes for different purposes?

In my honest opinion if you want to cram everything into client class go for it, but I personally prefer to have my client class as small as possible and use different classes for other purposes.

Read full topic
item.source: Need to talk with an average or better coder

item.title: Need to talk with an average or better coder
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

I’ll only answer questions that I understand what you mean.

How packets are sent/received:

When a someone clicks on an item on the ground, it sends a packet to the server to pick it up. I’ll show you an example of picking up an item below:

[code=java]case 236: // or whatever the packet is for picking up items
pItemY = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
pItemId = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
pItemX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();

if (freeSlots() < 1) {
sendMessage(“You have no room in your inventory.”);
break;
}
int itemAmount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(pItemId, pItemX, pItemY);
if (ClickCount <= 2) {
ClickCount += 4;
if(absX == pItemX && absY == pItemY) {
addItem(pItemId, itemAmount);
ItemHandler.removeItem(pItemId, pItemX, pItemY, itemAmount);
} else {
walkingToItem = true;
}
}
break;[/code]
(I know my code is a sloppy pile of shit and could probably done more efficiently but you know, I’m to lazy etc).

As for your other question:
I’m not entirely sure, but I think there’s a 508/525 server programmed in C++.

Read full topic
item.source: Need to talk with an average or better coder
